#Text=House of Lords approve same-sex marriage bill at third reading
#Text=Tuesday , July 16 , 2013
#Text=Members of the London Gay Men 's Chorus outside Parliament to celebrate the passage at Third Reading of the Marriage ( Same Sex Couples ) Bill .
#Text=Image : Tom Morris .
#Text=A religious protester outside Parliament .
#Text=Image : Tom Morris .
#Text=Ice cream and cake being handed out at the demonstration celebrating passage .
#Text=Image : Tom Morris .

#Text=Yesterday , the United Kingdom ' s House of Lords passed the Marriage ( Same Sex Couples ) Bill at Third Reading , the last major step in changing the law to allow marriages between same-sex partners in England and Wales .
#Text=The bill is to become law this week and same-sex marriage ceremonies are likely to start in 2014 .
#Text=During the brief debate in the Lords , Peers supporting the law wore pink carnations .
#Text=Lord Alli
#Text=, who is openly gay , said because of passing the law " my life and many others will be better today than it was yesterday " .
#Text=The Lords discussed an amendment to review how to deal with survivor pension benefits due to the same-sex partners of those in civil partnerships .

#Text=Other amendments the Lords have discussed include a review on whether to allow humanists to conduct weddings , and a review on whether to allow opposite-sex partners to enter into civil partnerships .
#Text=A handful of opponents of the Bill spoke during the debate including Lord Cormack , who said : " Those who support the Bill have won ; there is no doubt about that .
#Text=It pretends that there is no difference between a man and a woman .
#Text=From this deceit have sprung all the problems we have been wrestling with — problems we have failed to resolve and which will bedevil generations to come .
#Text="

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=In summing up the debate , Baroness Stowell said :  I believe that we have brought forward a Bill that is a force for good and that the change it brings about is right and reflects the change in society .

_	_	_	_

#Text=A group of supporters of the Bill held a celebration outside Parliament yesterday during the debate and carrying on into the evening .

#Text=A planned demonstration by Christian Concern was cancelled to  conserve energy " as " there will not be a vote at the third reading of the same sex marriage bill on Monday and what happens on that day in the House of Lords will be a mere formality " .
